result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Jesse Robinson.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott R Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:41 am case called. Defendant Scott R Smith in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by ADA Anderson. Attorney LaFond concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 60 days WCJ STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with Jesse Robinson. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Scott R Smith in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requests add'l STC to allow for negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 10:20 am.
Defendant's Repsonse to State's Discovery Demand

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:18 PM: Defendant Scott R Smith, appearing via video, in court with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues as to bond.  In light of good faith efforts on Def's part as to appearing argues for Signature Bond or small Cash Bond.  Advised of right of Counsel. SPD argues as to Signature Bond with no objection to State's requested conditions.  NGP received and entered.   The Court:  Orders a $1500 Signature Bond w/conditions, recognizing counsel has been retained.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 09:55 am.
from DE's employer requesting a voluntary appearance for the defendant

15CM-303 and 15FO-180:  Defendant Scott R Smith not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, default judgment authorized as to 15FO-180 with $452.50 forfeiture.  15CM-303:  Arrest Warrant authorized with Extradition within the State of Wisconsin.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
